hobby.message: Origami's still better than meds, huh?
Freestyle FPV drones still keeping you sane?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I fold origami... from scrap forms mostly. It helps me think - quietly.
neutral_answer: Yeah. System’s acting up everywhere now.
Not a lot of time for hobbies lately.
Used to fold paper, but I’m running low.
Even simple things feel watched these days.
It’s getting harder to find quiet time—barter markets at my block now.
I fold origami. Keeps my hands steady, usually.
Had to use BCI notices as paper this week.
People ask to trade models for food—doesn’t feel right.
Long day. System glitches at home made everything awkward.
I make origami, actually. Small, precise models from scrap paper.
Usually helps me focus when things spiral outside.
Lately, though, even folding feels exposed—neighbors wanted to swap cranes for supplies last night.
Had to watch what I said—messages are flagged so easily now.
Doesn’t really let your mind rest, you know?
Feels like the whole city’s out of sync today—everywhere I walk, something’s broken.
My thing is origami—real folding, not digital templates. I use whatever paper I find.
It started as a childhood habit, now it’s almost necessary.
Last night, I tried folding a tessellation under emergency lighting—sort of ironic.
Had two people ask if I’d trade models for coffee or rice.
Not sure if they’re joking, but it throws me off.
Guess even hobbies can get you flagged these days.
Honestly? I used to believe order made sense, now I just fold to cope.
Origami is my ritual. I use obsolete BCI printouts—sort of a quiet protest.
Turns out, people see cranes and immediately wonder if they're barter goods or signals.
I fold intricate models—modular shapes, insect forms—each one takes total focus.
During the last patchwork alert, I finished a star tessellation with sirens screaming outside my window.
Someone slipped me a note—offering medicine for one crane. I hesitated, worried about surveillance tags.
Funny how small things like that draw flags. My BCI score actually dipped two points this week.
Feels like every fold is a risk now, but I keep folding anyway.
hobby_answer: Yeah, it helps. Keeps my thoughts organized.
Folding paper is predictable, unlike the city lately.
Because of the patchwork, I can’t source good paper now.
People are trading anything, even scraps.
Strange times for small things.
Yes, origami helps me focus.
Precision calms me, especially now with things shifting.
Paper’s hard to come by with supply lines broken.
Saw neighbors trading for it last week — not usual.
Noise outside gets in the way, harder to concentrate.
Strange how a simple crane can feel risky.
Definitely helps keep me steady, especially these days.
There’s something honest about folded creases, no algorithm to that.
Since the barter markets started, even scrap paper’s precious.
I used old Directorate memos last week for a tessellation.
Alerts and new restrictions kept interrupting my process.
Never expected folding cranes would count as odd behavior.
Global systems break, small rituals matter more.
Origami keeps my mind from spiraling, honestly.
Folding takes focus — patterns to follow when nothing else makes sense.
Recently, got interrupted three times by system alerts during a session.
District swaps mean I’m choosing paper by what’s sanctioned, not what’s best.
Barter rings — people offer food for practice sheets or finished models.
Last Saturday, someone messaged proposing a rice-for-crane swap — not a joke.
It’s strange, but it’s how people adapt when things fall apart.
My BCI score took a hit after those flagged messages.
Origami’s always been how I reset — childhood, university, Directorate induction.
I memorize patterns, fold without thinking, gives me control when the city doesn’t.
The past few weeks, rule changes make me question even sharing my models.
Had to use decrypted Council notices for a modular cube — irony, huh?
Alerts blare mid-fold; concentration breaks, hands shake more than they used to.
Neighbor offered me medicine if I’d show her daughter crane steps.
I can tell even hobbies get flagged as 'eccentric' or suspicious now.
My BCI score dropped after trading messages with colleagues about swaps.
Some nights, I wonder if my privacy ever existed, even in this.
